cards.name: Mausoleum Guard
cards.text: When Mausoleum Guard dies, create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.
cards.flavor: "Ghoulcallers trying to get in, geists trying to get out . . . . This duty is never dull."
cards.originalText: When Mausoleum Guard dies, put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Phantom General
cards.text: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: After his death, the general was reunited with fallen soldiers from over thirty of his campaigns.

rulings.text: A creature token that's a copy of a nontoken creature is still a token. It will get +1/+1, but the original nontoken creature will not.

cards.originalText: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Vampire Outcasts
cards.text:
Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
cards.originalText:
Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Revenant Patriarch
cards.text:
When Revenant Patriarch enters the battlefield, if {W} was spent to cast it, target player skips their next combat phase.
Revenant Patriarch can't block.
cards.originalText:
When Revenant Patriarch enters the battlefield, if {W} was spent to cast it, target player skips his or her next combat phase.
Revenant Patriarch can't block.

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
cards.flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

cards.name: Butcher of Malakir
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Butcher of Malakir or another creature you control dies, each opponent sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: His verdict is always guilty. His sentence is always death.

rulings.text: When the triggered ability resolves, first the player whose turn it is (if that player is an opponent) chooses which creature they will sacrifice, then each other opponent in turn order does the same, then all chosen creatures are sacrificed at the same time.

If multiple creatures you control (possibly including Butcher of Malakir itself) are put into their owners' graveyards at the same time, Butcher of Malakir's triggered ability will trigger that many times.

If you control more than one Butcher of Malakir and a creature you control is put into a graveyard, each of those Butchers' abilities will trigger. Each opponent will sacrifice a creature each time one of those abilities resolves.

If you and an opponent each control a Butcher of Malakir and a creature is put into a graveyard, a chain reaction happens. First the ability of one player's Butcher will trigger, causing each opponent to sacrifice a creature. That sacrifice causes the ability of the other player's Butcher to trigger, and so on.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Butcher of Malakir or another creature you control dies, each opponent sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Vampire's Bite
cards.text:
Kicker {2}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B} as you cast this spell.)
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn. If this spell was kicked, that creature gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
cards.originalText:
Kicker {2}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B} as you cast this spell.)
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn. If Vampire's Bite was kicked, that creature gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Decompose
cards.text: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Sheesh! How am I supposed to make a decent living around here?"
—Cabal grave robber
cards.originalText: Exile up to three target cards from a single graveyard.

cards.name: Sorin's Thirst
cards.text: Sorin's Thirst deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "All your steel won't protect you if your will is weak."

rulings.text: If the creature is an illegal target when Sorin's Thirst tries to resolve, Sorin's Thirst won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain life.

cards.originalText: Sorin's Thirst deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Urge to Feed
cards.text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn. You may tap any number of untapped Vampire creatures you control. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on each of those Vampires.

rulings.text: You don't choose which untapped Vampire creatures you control to tap (if any) until Urge to Feed resolves.

If you cast Urge to Feed targeting an untapped Vampire creature you control with toughness 3, its toughness will be reduced to 0 by the -3/-3 effect. However, state-based actions aren't checked until the spell has finished resolving. You may then tap that Vampire and put a +1/+1 counter on it, raising its toughness to 1. It will remain on the battlefield.
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Urge to Feed resolves, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You can't tap any Vampires.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn. You may tap any number of untapped Vampire creatures you control. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on each of those Vampires.

cards.name: Zealous Persecution
cards.text: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and creatures your opponents control get -1/-1.
cards.flavor:
"Jharic returned from Grixis changed, a haunted look in her eyes. She destroyed them with an unholy glee that made me shudder."
—Knight-Captain Wyhorn
cards.originalText: Until end of turn, creatures you control get +1/+1 and creatures your opponents control get -1/-1.

cards.name: Lingering Souls
cards.text:
Create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.
Flashback {1}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: The murdered inhabitants of Hollowhenge impart to the living the terror they felt in death.
cards.originalText:
Put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
Flashback {1}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Mortify
cards.text: Destroy target creature or enchantment.
cards.flavor: Many who cross Sorin's path come down with a sudden and fatal case of being-in-the-way-of-a-millennia-old-vampire.

rulings.text: This spell isn't Modal. When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an enchantment, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature or enchantment.

cards.name: Spectral Procession
cards.text: Create three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.
cards.flavor:
"I need never remember my past associates, my victims, my mistakes. Innistrad preserves them all for me."
—Sorin Markov

rulings.text: If an effect reduces the cost to cast a spell by an amount of generic mana, it applies to a monocolored hybrid spell only if you've chosen a method of paying for it that includes generic mana.

A card with a monocolored hybrid mana symbol in its mana cost is each of the colors that appears in its mana cost, regardless of what mana was spent to cast it. Thus, Spectral Procession is white even if you spend six blue mana to cast it.

A card with monocolored hybrid mana symbols in its mana cost has a converted mana cost equal to the highest possible cost it could be cast for. Its converted mana cost never changes. Thus, Spectral Procession has a converted mana cost of 6, even if you spend {W}{W}{W} to cast it.

If a cost includes more than one monocolored hybrid mana symbol, you can choose a different way to pay for each symbol. For example, you can pay for Spectral Procession by spending {W}{W}{W}, {2}{W}{W}, {4}{W}, or {6}.

cards.originalText: Put three 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Unmake
cards.text: Exile target creature.
cards.flavor: A gwyllion's favorite trap is the vanity mirror. A bewitched piece of glass traps the looker's soul and does away with the body.
cards.originalText: Exile target creature.

cards.name: Ancient Craving
cards.text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: Knowledge demands sacrifice.
cards.originalText: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.

cards.name: Mark of the Vampire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has lifelink.
cards.flavor:
"My 'condition' is a trial. The weak are consumed by it. The strong transcend it."
—Sorin Markov

rulings.text: Multiple instances of lifelink on the same creature are redundant.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Field of Souls
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.

rulings.text: A creature card that you own but don't control will be put into your graveyard if that creature dies, and Field of Souls's ability will trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Absorb Vis
cards.text:
Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
Basic landcycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, basic landcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a basic land card. You don't choose the type of basic land card you'll find until you're performing the search. After you choose a basic land card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Basic landcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on a card being basic landcycled. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops a basic landcycling ability from being activated.

Basic landcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with basic landcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose not to find a basic land card, even if there is one in your library.

cards.originalText:
Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
Basic landcycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Death Grasp
cards.text: Death Grasp deals X damage to any target. You gain X life.
cards.flavor: Plate mail, the skin of the chest, the rib cage, the heart—all useless against the mage who can reach directly for the soul.
cards.originalText: Death Grasp deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain X life.

cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Without the interfering hands of civilization, nature will always shape itself to its own needs.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded
cards.text:
+1: Draw a card, then discard a card at random.
−4: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.
−6: Gain control of all creatures until end of turn. Untap them. They gain haste until end of turn.

rulings.text: The number of cards in the target player's hand is determined when Tibalt's second ability resolves.
When Tibalt's third ability resolves, all creatures will become untapped and gain haste, including ones you controlled before the ability resolved.

foreignNames.name: 悪鬼の血脈、ティボルト

cards.originalText:
+1: Draw a card, then discard a card at random.
-4: Tibalt, the Fiend-Blooded deals damage equal to the number of cards in target player's hand to that player.

cards.name: Goblin Arsonist
cards.text: When Goblin Arsonist dies, you may have it deal 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: With great power comes great risk of getting yourself killed.
cards.originalText: When Goblin Arsonist dies, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Scorched Rusalka
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice a creature: Scorched Rusalka deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Each small blaze she sets jogs her memory, letting her piece together the mystery of her own fiery end.
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice a creature: Scorched Rusalka deals 1 damage to target player.

cards.name: Reassembling Skeleton
cards.text: {1}{B}: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"They may show up with the wrong thigh bone or mandible, but they always show up."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord
cards.originalText: {1}{B}: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Ashmouth Hound
cards.text: Whenever Ashmouth Hound blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Ashmouth Hound deals 1 damage to that creature.
cards.flavor: Its fiery paws make it easy to track, which is very useful when you want to go in exactly the opposite direction.

rulings.text: Ashmouth Hound's ability triggers once for each creature it blocks or becomes blocked by.

cards.originalText: Whenever Ashmouth Hound blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Ashmouth Hound deals 1 damage to that creature.

cards.name: Hellspark Elemental
cards.text:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Hellspark Elemental.
Unearth {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Hellspark Elemental.
Unearth {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Vithian Stinger
cards.text:
{T}: Vithian Stinger deals 1 damage to any target.
Unearth {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

rulings.text: If you activate a card's unearth ability but that card is removed from your graveyard before the ability resolves, that unearth ability will resolve and do nothing.

Activating a creature card's unearth ability isn't the same as casting the creature card. The unearth ability is put on the stack, but the creature card is not. Spells and abilities that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle) will interact with unearth, but spells and abilities that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul) will not.

At the beginning of the end step, a creature returned to the battlefield with unearth is exiled. This is a delayed triggered ability, and it can be countered by effects such as Stifle or Voidslime that counter triggered abilities. If the ability is countered, the creature will stay on the battlefield and the delayed trigger won't trigger again. However, the replacement effect will still exile the creature when it eventually leaves the battlefield.

Unearth grants haste to the creature that's returned to the battlefield. However, neither of the "exile" abilities is granted to that creature. If that creature loses all its abilities, it will still be exiled at the beginning of the end step, and if it would leave the battlefield, it is still exiled instead.

If a creature returned to the battlefield with unearth would leave the battlefield for any reason, it's exiled instead — unless the spell or ability that's causing the creature to leave the battlefield is actually trying to exile it! In that case, it succeeds at exiling it. If it later returns the creature card to the battlefield (as Oblivion Ring or Flickerwisp might, for example), the creature card will return to the battlefield as a new object with no relation to its previous existence. The unearth effect will no longer apply to it.

foreignNames.name: ヴィティアのとげ刺し

cards.originalText:
{T}: Vithian Stinger deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Unearth {1}{R} ({1}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.text:
Shambling Remains can't block.
Unearth {B}{R} ({B}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Coal Stoker
cards.text: When Coal Stoker enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, add {R}{R}{R}.
cards.flavor:
"The day is mine! I sent three such creatures against my foe, then watched as my magefire popped her soldiers like overripe spleenfruits."
—Dobruk the Unstable, pyromancer

rulings.text: You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).
If a creature (such as Clone) enters the battlefield as a copy of this creature, the copy's "enters-the-battlefield" ability will still trigger as long as you cast that creature spell from your hand.

cards.originalText: When Coal Stoker enters the battlefield, if you cast it from your hand, add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Lavaborn Muse
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has two or fewer cards in hand, Lavaborn Muse deals 3 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"Her voice is disaster, painful and final."
—Matoc, lavamancer

rulings.text: The number of cards in hand is checked both at the beginning of upkeep and when the triggered ability resolves.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has two or fewer cards in hand, Lavaborn Muse deals 3 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Mad Prophet
cards.text:
Haste
{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "There's no heron in the moon! It's a shrew, a five-legged shrew, with a voice like whispering thunder!"

rulings.text: Discarding a card is part of the ability's activation cost. You can't activate the ability if you have no cards in hand.

cards.originalText:
Haste
{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card.

cards.name: Hellrider
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever a creature you control attacks, Hellrider deals 1 damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.
cards.flavor:
"Behind every devil's mayhem lurks a demon's scheme."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

rulings.text: Creatures you control may attack multiple players and/or planeswalkers. For each attacking creature, Hellrider will deal damage to the corresponding player or planeswalker.

cards.originalText:
Haste
Whenever a creature you control attacks, Hellrider deals 1 damage to defending player.

cards.name: Skirsdag Cultist
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skirsdag Cultist deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "Within blood is life. Within life is fire. Within fire is the path to our masters' glory!"
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skirsdag Cultist deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Corpse Connoisseur
cards.text:
When Corpse Connoisseur enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card and put that card into your graveyard. If you do, shuffle your library.
Unearth {3}{B} ({3}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

rulings.text: If you activate a card's unearth ability but that card is removed from your graveyard before the ability resolves, that unearth ability will resolve and do nothing.

Activating a creature card's unearth ability isn't the same as casting the creature card. The unearth ability is put on the stack, but the creature card is not. Spells and abilities that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle) will interact with unearth, but spells and abilities that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul) will not.

At the beginning of the end step, a creature returned to the battlefield with unearth is exiled. This is a delayed triggered ability, and it can be countered by effects such as Stifle or Voidslime that counter triggered abilities. If the ability is countered, the creature will stay on the battlefield and the delayed trigger won't trigger again. However, the replacement effect will still exile the creature when it eventually leaves the battlefield.

Unearth grants haste to the creature that's returned to the battlefield. However, neither of the "exile" abilities is granted to that creature. If that creature loses all its abilities, it will still be exiled at the beginning of the end step, and if it would leave the battlefield, it is still exiled instead.

If a creature returned to the battlefield with unearth would leave the battlefield for any reason, it's exiled instead — unless the spell or ability that's causing the creature to leave the battlefield is actually trying to exile it! In that case, it succeeds at exiling it. If it later returns the creature card to the battlefield (as Oblivion Ring or Flickerwisp might, for example), the creature card will return to the battlefield as a new object with no relation to its previous existence. The unearth effect will no longer apply to it.

rulings.text: If you activate a card's unearth ability but that card is removed from your graveyard before the ability resolves, that unearth ability will resolve and do nothing.

Activating a creature card's unearth ability isn't the same as casting the creature card. The unearth ability is put on the stack, but the creature card is not. Spells and abilities that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle) will interact with unearth, but spells and abilities that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul) will not.

At the beginning of the end step, a creature returned to the battlefield with unearth is exiled. This is a delayed triggered ability, and it can be countered by effects such as Stifle or Voidslime that counter triggered abilities. If the ability is countered, the creature will stay on the battlefield and the delayed trigger won't trigger again. However, the replacement effect will still exile the creature when it eventually leaves the battlefield.

Unearth grants haste to the creature that's returned to the battlefield. However, neither of the "exile" abilities is granted to that creature. If that creature loses all its abilities, it will still be exiled at the beginning of the end step, and if it would leave the battlefield, it is still exiled instead.

If a creature returned to the battlefield with unearth would leave the battlefield for any reason, it's exiled instead — unless the spell or ability that's causing the creature to leave the battlefield is actually trying to exile it! In that case, it succeeds at exiling it. If it later returns the creature card to the battlefield (as Oblivion Ring or Flickerwisp might, for example), the creature card will return to the battlefield as a new object with no relation to its previous existence. The unearth effect will no longer apply to it.
Scourge Devil's triggered ability affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves, including Scourge Devil itself. Creatures you begin to control later in the turn won't get +1/+0.

cards.originalText:
When Scourge Devil enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
Unearth {2}{R} ({2}{R}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Gang of Devils
cards.text: When Gang of Devils dies, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three targets.
cards.flavor:
"Well, how could I know they'd explode?"
—Gregel, township militia

rulings.text: You divide the damage as you put Gang of Devils's triggered ability on the stack, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage. (In other words, as you put the ability on the stack, you choose whether to have it deal 3 damage to a single target, 2 damage to one target and 1 damage to another target, or 1 damage to each of three targets.)

cards.originalText: When Gang of Devils dies, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Bump in the Night
cards.text:
Target opponent loses 3 life.
Flashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: It's not just the wind. It's not all in your head. And it's definitely something to worry about.
cards.originalText:
Target opponent loses 3 life.
Flashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Blazing Salvo

cards.flavor: Barbarians equate courage with the ability to endure pain.

cards.name: Faithless Looting
cards.text:
Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: "Avacyn has abandoned us! We have nothing left except what we can take!"

rulings.text: You draw two cards and discard two cards all while Faithless Looting is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText:
Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Flame Slash
cards.text: Flame Slash deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: After millennia asleep, the Eldrazi had forgotten about Zendikar's fiery temper and dislike of strangers.
cards.originalText: Flame Slash deals 4 damage to target creature.

Geistflame deals 1 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: Innistrad pyromancers find their best raw materials in the fury of the dead.
cards.originalText:
Geistflame deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Recoup
cards.text:
Target sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost. (Mana cost includes color.)
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Target sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Terminate
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"I've seen death before. My mother succumbing to illness, my comrades bleeding on the battlefield . . . But I'd never seen anything as dreadful as that."
—Taani, berserker of Etlan
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Strangling Soot
cards.text:
Destroy target creature with toughness 3 or less.
Flashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor:
"What good is your blade without your breath?"
—Greht, Gathan warlord
cards.originalText:
Destroy target creature with toughness 3 or less.
Flashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Browbeat
cards.text: Any player may have Browbeat deal 5 damage to them. If no one does, target player draws three cards.
cards.flavor:
"Pained defiance or shameful surrender—every reaction is a pleasant surprise."
—Tibalt
cards.originalText: Any player may have Browbeat deal 5 damage to him or her. If no one does, target player draws three cards.

cards.name: Breaking Point
cards.text: Any player may have Breaking Point deal 6 damage to them. If no one does, destroy all creatures. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: "Enough!"
cards.originalText: Any player may have Breaking Point deal 6 damage to him or her. If no one does, destroy all creatures. Creatures destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Sulfuric Vortex
cards.text:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Sulfuric Vortex deals 2 damage to that player.
If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Sulfuric Vortex deals 2 damage to that player.
If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.

cards.name: Blightning
cards.text: Blightning deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker. That player or that planeswalker's controller discards two cards.
cards.flavor: In the spirit of inquiry, Tibalt applied a battery of agony spells. They yielded nothing on the vampire's whereabouts, but the screams were reward enough.

rulings.text: The targeted player will discard two cards even if some or all of Blightning's damage is prevented or redirected.

cards.originalText: Blightning deals 3 damage to target player. That player discards two cards.

cards.name: Flame Javelin
cards.text:
({2/R} can be paid with any two mana or with {R}. This card's converted mana cost is 6.)
Flame Javelin deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Gyara Spearhurler would have been renowned for her deadly accuracy, if it weren't for her deadly accuracy.

rulings.text: If an effect reduces the cost to cast a spell by an amount of generic mana, it applies to a monocolored hybrid spell only if you've chosen a method of paying for it that includes generic mana.

A card with a monocolored hybrid mana symbol in its mana cost is each of the colors that appears in its mana cost, regardless of what mana was spent to cast it. Thus, Flame Javelin is red even if you spend six green mana to cast it.

A card with monocolored hybrid mana symbols in its mana cost has a converted mana cost equal to the highest possible cost it could be cast for. Its converted mana cost never changes. Thus, Flame Javelin has a converted mana cost of 6, even if you spend {R}{R}{R} to cast it.

If a cost includes more than one monocolored hybrid mana symbol, you can choose a different way to pay for each symbol. For example, you can pay for Flame Javelin by spending {R}{R}{R}, {2}{R}{R}, {4}{R}, or {6}.

cards.originalText: Flame Javelin deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Torrent of Souls
cards.text: Return up to one target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield if {B} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. Creatures target player controls get +2/+0 and gain haste until end of turn if {R} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. (Do both if {B}{R} was spent.)

rulings.text: This spell cares about what mana was spent to pay its total cost, not just what mana was spent to pay the hybrid mana symbol in its cost.
This spell checks on resolution to see if any mana of the appropriate colors were spent to pay its cost. It doesn't matter how much mana of that color was spent; the effect isn't multiplied.
If this spell is copied, the copy will not have had any colors of mana paid for it, no matter what colors were spent on the original spell.

cards.originalText: Return up to one target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield if {B} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. Creatures target player controls get +2/+0 and gain haste until end of turn if {R} was spent to cast Torrent of Souls. (Do both if {B}{R} was spent.)

cards.name: Devil's Play
cards.text:
Devil's Play deals X damage to any target.
Flashback {X}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: A devil's hands are never idle.
cards.originalText:
Devil's Play deals X damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {X}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Akoum Refuge
cards.text:
Akoum Refuge enters the battlefield tapped.
When Akoum Refuge enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.
cards.originalText:
Akoum Refuge enters the battlefield tapped.
When Akoum Refuge enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Rakdos Carnarium
cards.text:
Rakdos Carnarium enters the battlefield tapped.
When Rakdos Carnarium enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {B}{R}.

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

cards.originalText:
Rakdos Carnarium enters the battlefield tapped.
When Rakdos Carnarium enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {B}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mountain
cards.originalText: B

cards.name: Mountain
cards.originalText: R

cards.name: Mountain
cards.originalText: R

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: B

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: B

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: B

cards.name: Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you draw a card, Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind deals 1 damage to any target.
{T}: Draw a card.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability causes you to draw multiple cards, Niv-Mizzet's ability triggers that many times.

If dealing 1 damage to a permanent or player causes you to draw a card, perhaps because Niv-Mizzet is enchanted by Curiosity, you'll continue this loop until the loop is interrupted, perhaps by a player losing the game.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you draw a card, Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
{T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Kiln Fiend
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Kiln Fiend gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It traps an explosion within its stony skin.

rulings.text: If you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Kiln Fiend's ability triggers and goes on the stack on top of it. The ability will resolve before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Kiln Fiend gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Electromancer
cards.text: Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.flavor: When asked how much power is required, Izzet mages always answer "more."

rulings.text: Two Goblin Electromancers will make instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {2} less to cast, and so on.
Goblin Electromancer can't reduce colored mana costs or {C} in the cost of instant or sorcery spells.

If there are additional costs to cast a spell, such as a kicker cost or a cost imposed by another effect (such as the one imposed by Thalia, Guardian of Thraben's ability), apply those increases before applying cost reductions.
Goblin Electromancer can reduce alternative costs such as overload costs and flashback costs.

cards.originalText: Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Izzet Guildmage
cards.text:
({U/R} can be paid with either {U} or {R}.)
{2}{U}: Copy target instant spell you control with converted mana cost 2 or less. You may choose new targets for the copy.
{2}{R}: Copy target sorcery spell you control with converted mana cost 2 or less. You may choose new targets for the copy.

foreignNames.name: イゼットのギルド魔道士

cards.originalText:
{2}{U}: Copy target instant spell you control with converted mana cost 2 or less. You may choose new targets for the copy.
{2}{R}: Copy target sorcery spell you control with converted mana cost 2 or less. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.name: Gelectrode
cards.text:
{T}: Gelectrode deals 1 damage to any target.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may untap Gelectrode.
cards.flavor:
"Diametrically opposing energies in self-sealed plasmodermic bubbles make great pets!"
—Trivaz, Izzet mage
cards.originalText:
{T}: Gelectrode deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may untap Gelectrode.

cards.name: Wee Dragonauts
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Wee Dragonauts gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The blazekite is a simple concept, really—just a vehicular application of dragscoop ionics and electropropulsion magnetronics."
—Juzba, Izzet tinker

rulings.text: Wee Dragonauts's triggered ability will resolve before the spell that caused it to trigger.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Wee Dragonauts gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Steamcore Weird
cards.text: When Steamcore Weird enters the battlefield, if {R} was spent to cast Steamcore Weird, it deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Like many Izzet creations, weirds are based on wild contradictions yet somehow manage to work.
cards.originalText: When Steamcore Weird enters the battlefield, if {R} was spent to cast Steamcore Weird, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Shrewd Hatchling
cards.text:
Shrewd Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
{U/R}: Target creature can't block Shrewd Hatchling this turn.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a red spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.

rulings.text: If you cast a spell that's both of the listed colors, both abilities will trigger. You'll remove a total of two -1/-1 counters from the Hatchling.
If there are no -1/-1 counters on it when the triggered ability resolves, the ability does nothing. There is no penalty for not being able to remove a counter.

cards.originalText:
Shrewd Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
{U/R}: Target creature can't block Shrewd Hatchling this turn.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a red spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.

cards.name: Ogre Savant
cards.text: When Ogre Savant enters the battlefield, if {U} was spent to cast Ogre Savant, return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: He's an oxymoron.

rulings.text: If {U} was spent to cast Ogre Savant and no other creatures are on the battlefield, the Ogre will have to return itself.
The ability is not optional.

cards.originalText: When Ogre Savant enters the battlefield, if {U} was spent to cast Ogre Savant, return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Galvanoth
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it's an instant or sorcery card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.
cards.flavor: It chews open Mirrodin's husk and feeds on the outpouring of energy.

rulings.text: If the card you look at isn't an instant or sorcery card, it remains on top of your library. You don't reveal it.
You may pay additional costs, such as kicker costs, of the instant or sorcery card.
If the card has any mandatory additional costs, as Kuldotha Rebirth does, you must pay them in order to cast the spell.
If the card has an X in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as its value.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it's an instant or sorcery card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Izzet Chronarch
cards.text: When Izzet Chronarch enters the battlefield, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: He ensures not only whether but also when and where the lightning strikes twice.
cards.originalText: When Izzet Chronarch enters the battlefield, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Djinn Illuminatus
cards.text:
({U/R} can be paid with either {U} or {R}.)
Flying
Each instant and sorcery spell you cast has replicate. The replicate cost is equal to its mana cost. (When you cast it, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

rulings.text: If you cast a spell that already has replicate while you have this creature on the battlefield, the spell will have two replicate abilities: one with a replicate cost as printed on it, and one with a replicate cost equal to its mana cost. (In this set, both costs are always the same.) You may use either ability, or both abilities, to replicate the spell.
If you cast an instant or sorcery spell that has {X} in its mana cost, the value of X in the spell's replicate cost will be the same as the value of X you chose for its mana cost.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Each instant and sorcery spell you cast has replicate. The replicate cost is equal to its mana cost. (When you cast it, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor: The mizzium-sphere array drove her mind deep into the thought field, where only the rarest motes of genius may be plucked.

rulings.text: You draw three cards and put two cards back all while Brainstorm is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.

cards.name: Force Spike
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
cards.flavor: "I don't think so."

rulings.text: The payment is optional.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

cards.name: Magma Spray
cards.text: Magma Spray deals 2 damage to target creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.flavor:
"Jund is a wounded world. Beware its searing blood spilling out onto the surface."
—Rakka Mar

rulings.text: Magma Spray's replacement effect will exile the target creature if it would die this turn for any reason, not just due to lethal damage. It applies to the target creature even if Magma Spray deals no damage to it (due to a prevention effect) or Magma Spray deals damage to a different creature (due to a redirection effect).

cards.originalText: Magma Spray deals 2 damage to target creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.name: Isochron Scepter
cards.text:
Imprint — When Isochron Scepter enters the battlefield, you may exile an instant card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your hand.
{2}, {T}: You may copy the exiled card. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

rulings.text: If the imprinted card leaves the exile zone while the activated ability is on the stack, the copy can't be made.
If Isochron Scepter leaves the battlefield while the activated ability is on the stack, the ability can still make a copy.
You cast the copy while the ability is resolving and still on the stack.

Because you're already casting the spell using an alternative cost (by casting it without paying its mana cost), you can't pay any other alternative costs for the card. You can pay additional costs, such as kicker costs. If the card has any mandatory additional costs, you must pay those.
If the exiled card has X in its mana cost, you must choose 0 as the value for X when casting it.
If you don't want to cast the copy, you can choose not to; the copy ceases to exist the next time state-based actions are checked.

The converted mana cost of a split card is determined by the combined mana cost of its two halves. When you activate the second ability, you may choose to cast either half of the split card, but you may not cast both halves.

cards.originalText:
Imprint — When Isochron Scepter enters the battlefield, you may exile an instant card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your hand.
{2}, {T}: You may copy the exiled card. If you do, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Izzet Signet
cards.flavor: The Izzet signet is redesigned often, each time becoming closer to a vanity portrait of Niv-Mizzet.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {U}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Call to Heel
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Its controller draws a card.
cards.flavor: On Bant, a sigil is both a prize of honor and a bond of duty. The one who bears it may be called to fulfill that charge at any moment.

rulings.text: The player who draws a card is the player who controls the creature when Call to Heel resolves. This may not be the player whose hand the creature is put into.
If the targeted creature becomes an illegal target before Call to Heel resolves, Call to Heel doesn't resolve. No one draws a card.

cards.originalText: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Its controller draws a card.

cards.name: Train of Thought
cards.text:
Replicate {1}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "But then . . . oh, but . . . which means . . . which would lead to . . . exactly!"
cards.originalText:
Replicate {1}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost.)
Draw a card.

cards.name: Pyromatics
cards.text:
Replicate {1}{R} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Pyromatics deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
Replicate {1}{R} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Pyromatics deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Izzet Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {2}.
• Izzet Charm deals 2 damage to target creature.
• Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
cards.originalText: Choose one — Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {2}; or Izzet Charm deals 2 damage to target creature; or draw two cards, then discard two cards.

cards.name: Reminisce
cards.text: Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
cards.flavor: Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges.

rulings.text: This card won't be put into your graveyard until after it's finished resolving, which means it won't be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.

cards.originalText: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

cards.name: Thunderheads
cards.text:
Replicate {2}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost.)
Create a 3/3 blue Weird creature token with defender and flying. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: The clouds grew thick, and then they grew teeth.
cards.originalText:
Replicate {2}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost.)
Put a 3/3 blue Weird creature token with defender and flying onto the battlefield. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Vacuumelt
cards.text:
Replicate {2}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Replicate {2}{U} (When you cast this spell, copy it for each time you paid its replicate cost. You may choose new targets for the copies.)
Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Dissipate
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"This abomination never belonged in our world. I'm merely setting it free."
—Dierk, geistmage

rulings.text: The card does not go to the graveyard before being exiled.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not get exiled.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Quicksilver Dagger
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker. You draw a card."
cards.flavor: The dwarves call their quicksilver techniques "improvisational weaponsmithing."

rulings.text: The enchanted creature is the source of both the damage ability and the resultant damage, not Quicksilver Dagger. For example, if Quicksilver Dagger and Curiosity enchant the same creature, Curiosity's ability will trigger when the damage is dealt.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target player. You draw a card."

cards.name: Prophetic Bolt
cards.text: Prophetic Bolt deals 4 damage to any target. Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.originalText: Prophetic Bolt deals 4 damage to target creature or player. Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Overwhelming Intellect
cards.text: Counter target creature spell. Draw cards equal to that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: "My brain hurts."
cards.originalText: Counter target creature spell. Draw cards equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Sphinx-Bone Wand
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may put a charge counter on Sphinx-Bone Wand. If you do, Sphinx-Bone Wand deals damage equal to the number of charge counters on it to any target.
cards.flavor: Its host's final curse lies captured within.

rulings.text: If you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Sphinx-Bone Wand's ability triggers and goes on the stack on top of it. The ability will resolve before the spell does.
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target by the time the ability resolves, the ability doesn't resolve. You won't put a charge counter on Sphinx-Bone Wand and it won't deal damage.
If Sphinx-Bone Wand leaves the battlefield before its ability resolves, you won't be able to put a charge counter on it. As a result, it won't deal damage.

foreignNames.name: スフィンクスの骨の杖

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may put a charge counter on Sphinx-Bone Wand. If you do, Sphinx-Bone Wand deals damage equal to the number of charge counters on it to target creature or player.

cards.name: Street Spasm
cards.text:
Street Spasm deals X damage to target creature without flying you don't control.
Overload {X}{X}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

rulings.text: If you don't pay the overload cost of a spell, that spell will have a single target. If you pay the overload cost, the spell won't have any targets.
Because a spell with overload doesn't target when its overload cost is paid, it may affect permanents with hexproof or with protection from the appropriate color.
Note that if the spell with overload is dealing damage, protection from that spell's color will still prevent that damage.
Overload doesn't change when you can cast the spell.
Casting a spell with overload doesn't change that spell's mana cost. You just pay the overload cost instead.
Effects that cause you to pay more or less for a spell will cause you to pay that much more or less while casting it for its overload cost, too.
If you are instructed to cast a spell with overload "without paying its mana cost," you can't choose to pay its overload cost instead.

cards.originalText:
Street Spasm deals X damage to target creature without flying you don't control.
Overload {X}{X}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its overload cost. If you do, change its text by replacing all instances of "target" with "each.")

cards.name: Invoke the Firemind
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Draw X cards.
• Invoke the Firemind deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor: To those in tune with the Firemind, there is no difference between knowledge and flame.

rulings.text: As you cast Invoke the Firemind, first you choose the mode (draw cards or deal damage), then you choose the value of X. You then choose a target, but only if you chose the second mode.

cards.originalText: Choose one — Draw X cards; or Invoke the Firemind deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Fire
cards.text: Fire deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two targets.
cards.originalText: Fire deals 2 damage divided as you choose among one or two target creatures and/or players.
